content:
Hi, I wanted to ask if there is any way to achieve persistent caching for vim/nvim so that indexing doesn't start from scratch every time we reopen a file? I remember seeing a comment quite long ago by @matklad (can't find it now) saying that RA wants to focus on startup performance and having persistent storage may shift that focus. So persistent store wasn't a priority.
Is there any update on that now? If not is there any workaround to achieve this?
https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/1650, no updates yet. A workaround is to use :e or a file manager plugin.
